name: karen ledford
text: Tasted ok. Nice presentation. Quick service. I wish they promoted spicy options more. Definitely could have used more kick.

name: Daniel Udo
text: Not a fan of it threw it away after a few spoon fulls. It's really fatty broth and everything is discolored for some reason. Disappointed by the food. Food isn't bland, it's just not good. I decided to get something else. But for the price tbh not worth it unless u split it with someone.

name: Leslie Bierman
text: The best ramen in town! Great food and great service. Staff are always very friendly and the food is fresh. Everything is delicious and has great flavor! I wouldn't go anywhere else. This is the place for authentic ramen!

name: Trevor Staub
text: Pathetic. The broth is thick and not true to Japanese style ramen and the pork belly was served as a giant hunk of mostly pork fat. How difficult would it be to slice it so it's edible with chopsticks? They were out of soda and charge an extra dollar for hot sauce which they were also out of.

name: David Arroyo
text: Disclaimer: we lived in Japan for several years and know what good ramen tastes like. With that said, this is the worst ramen I have ever tasted. It has grease floating everywhere. The flavor is so, and I do mean so far away from anything resembling anything good. The piece of "meat" was a chunk of pork fat. Overall, I neither recommend nor ever want to eat here again. Sunk cost of trying a new place to see if it was good or not...$12

name: David Lundgren
text: Good Ramen! Not a bad place at all to get tasty soup, but costs just a bit more than I'd like to pay. 30 bucks gets you two bottles of water and two medium sized bowls of soup.

name: David Higginbotham
text: So this sign was next to the register at Ichimor Imoto at the Pizitz food hall. I want the businesses here to survive, so what happens if the computer goes down? The food was okay, but I received only chopsticks and spoon with which to eat it. I was a little smart with the cash register attendant, so I left a tip on the computer for her. But really, this is a place where they bring your food to the counter and call your number. I'll probably pass on this place next time.

name: Nicole Herzog
text: Broth tasted like dirty dishwater and the bamboo shoots and egg were discolored in the pork ramen. Also tried the pork rice bowl and it was okay, but kind of off tasting. Rice and meat were tepid, pickled veggies were not great. Wasn't sure if it was supposed to be a hot or cold dish. It was neither. Certainly didn't taste freshly made.

name: jeffery kline
text:
Honestly flavors weren’t bad, but first thing is they are a bit confused on the menu on what shoyu, tonketsu and miso are (miso isn’t a pig people quiet the opposite of meat) but for the size quality for that price?! No thank you

Kline the ramen guy

name: Dingguo Zhang
text: Pricy and not good. I'm not a picky ramen eater, but I do better ramen at home than this

name: Jackie Brown
text: I got the sweet bbq steam buns! They were so cute!!!

name: Sky Jett
text: This is the 3rd time ive made a 30+ minute drive to eat here and they've been closed. It's 6 pm on a Saturday, the food hall is packed, and they are closed. Very disappointed.

name: Ryan Duke
text: Rolls are good but it is very pricy.

name: Katie V
text: Ramen noodles are instant noodles. Not worth the price
